data.title: Wall Street Is Bought In on Crypto’s Upside Potential, But Not Its Tech
data.metadata: Despite record levels of institutional investment, most Wall Street firms are still trading off-chain, says Annabelle Huang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Altius Labs.

data.title: Long DATs, Short Futures: A New Wrinkle On The Basis Trade
data.metadata: As regulated futures proliferate across alts, the “long DAT, short futures” trade could become an ideal way for Wall Street to capture crypto yield without touching a wallet or suffering from the intense volatility that defines crypto as an asset class, argues CoinFund’s Chris Perkins.

data.title: Stop Chasing DeFi Yields and Start Doing the Math
data.metadata: The DeFi industry has trained everyone to optimize for headline APY numbers while burying the costs that determine your returns, argues Blueprint Finance CEO Nic Roberts-Huntley

data.title: Ethereum Is Like a Shark. If It Stops Moving, It Will Die
Britain’s Digital ID Push Is Premature and Dangerous
Cleaning Up Crypto ATMs Isn’t Anti-Crypto
The AWS Outage Shows Why Crypto Can't Keep Relying On Centralized Infrastructure
dYdX Governance Approves Buyback Increase to 75% of Protocol Revenue
Leading Base DEX Aerodrome Merges Into Aero in Major Overhaul
Singapore's Central Bank to Trial Tokenized Bills, Introduce Stablecoin Laws
Trump Signs Bill to Reopen U.S. Government as Congress Suddenly Ramps Up Crypto Work
Bitcoin: The Dawn of a New Monetary Era
data.metadata: Seventeen years after Satoshi Nakamoto introduced Bitcoin to the world, it has grown from a cryptographic experiment into a global movement, argues Tony Yazbeck, co-founder of The Bitcoin Way.

data.title: MiCA Won’t Save Us From a Stablecoin Crisis. It Might Be Building One
data.metadata: MiCA deserves credit for imposing order on chaos, but its structure rests on a dangerous assumption: that proof-of-reserves equals proof-of-stability, argues Dr. Daniel D’Alvia. It does not.

data.title: The Bitcoin White Paper Offered a Blueprint for a More Reliable Financial System
data.metadata: Satoshi Nakamoto’s Bitcoin white paper did not describe the end of Bitcoin’s development but the beginning, argues Voltage’s Bobby Shell.

data.title: Crypto Privacy Shouldn't Be a Purity Test
data.metadata: By refusing to compromise on privacy, crypto risks marginalizing itself. There may be a path forward that respects both individual choice and practical constraints, says Rob Viglione, CEO of Horizen Labs.

data.title: Georgia's ‘Shadow Ruler’ Is Trying to Claw Back a Bitcoin Fortune Worth $1B
data.metadata: Ten years ago, he declined a credible offer to mine bitcoin, missing out on an opportunity to make billions. Now that his personal fortune is dwindling, Bidzina Ivanishvili is going to extreme lengths to get his hands on the bitcoin he sees as rightfully his.
